meanings.definition: To yield to superior strength or force
meanings.sent1: The small boat succumbs to the powerful waves.
meanings.sent2: He succumbs to his older brother's strength during play fights.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn door finally succumbs to the forceful push.
meanings.sent4: The old tree eventually succumbs to the relentless wind.
meanings.sent5: The fragile bridge succumbs to the weight of the heavy truck.

meanings.definition: To give way to pressure or temptation
meanings.sent1: She succumbs to the temptation of eating the delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: The tired student succumbs to the pressure of upcoming exams.
meanings.sent3: He always succumbs to the temptation of hitting the snooze button.
meanings.sent4: The dieter tries not to succumb to the temptation of fast food.
meanings.sent5: The athlete succumbs to the pressure and decides to withdraw from the race.

meanings.definition: To die or suffer a fatal outcome
meanings.sent1: The hero succumbs to his injuries after the epic battle.
meanings.sent2: The patient succumbs to the illness despite the doctor's efforts.
meanings.sent3: The villain finally succumbs to karma in the end.
meanings.sent4: The explorer succumbs to the harsh conditions of the Arctic.
meanings.sent5: The soldier bravely fights but eventually succumbs to his wounds.
